channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-22706] Jdbc storage handler incorrectly interprets boolean column value in derby
item.description: in case the column value is false ; the storage handler interprets it as true
item.summary: Jdbc storage handler incorrectly interprets boolean column value in derby

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: kgyrtkirk Is it similar to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-22433  ?

srahman I think it is....but I bumped into this on master thru sysdb usage; so there might be still some (corner) case which is not entirely correct - (...or there might be an issue when it's coming from sysdb?)
hm.. Can you please share the reproducible steps for this issue?

now that I've dived into this I'm starting to understand how unfortunate this is....this issue is somewhat specific to metastore tables

  • for boolean columns we use "CHAR(1)" for derby; I've tried the BOOLEAN type; but it didn't really worked (so our jpa implementation (as it is now) doesn't like the BOOLEAN datatype)
  • somehow updating the could to true/false thru the metastore/jpa way make the CHAR(1) column contain 'N' or 'Y'
  • when we access the same value thru the JDBC storage handler; we will end up in the getBoolean() method of the CHAR type which interprets "0" and "false" as false other values as true

right now I'm not sure where is the logic which transforms true/false into 'Y' and 'N' - but as a result of that conversion; we will see a bunch of 'true' values when using the sys database...

This could be probably fixed by extending the jdbc handler here to also accept 'N' as a false value in case the underlying BOOLEAN column is CHAR....

well; after some digging my hypothesis have confirmed; that datanucleus is pulling these Y/N into play...the translation is done at several places including this.

I played with the idea to try to reuse the parts which are doing this kind of conversions ; but they are kinda deeply tied to a plugin system inside datanucleus and it would look strange....

So I think the best course of action ; to have our sysdb show rational values is to interpret the char 'N' as false...

-1 overall

ATTACHMENT ID: 12990722 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
kgyrtkirk We need to do similar handling for insert queries

srahman well...it's not nice to have this fixed here in hive's jdbc-handler...but yes; it makes sense to also cover the write in case it's needed at some point
I've found traces that at some point derby wrote 0/1 into CHAR types and not true/false https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DERBY-4965

note: there is some very flexible error handling in the DBOutputFormat ...it may make resultsets disappear in some cases - when there is a jdbc issue

I fixed the write path - and extended the test to cover this as well.
